intro: Hippion gentianella, commonly known as the slender gentian, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Gentianaceae and is characterized by its striking blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in alpine or subalpine habitats, where it thrives in well-drained soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs, while its stems are upright and branching. The flowers bloom in late summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
